__e: I was in a home from the age of nine.
Guys there's no children in the house.
If you do this, she'll... she'll never have kids of her own.
I've never had any children of my own. And I've never even liked children.
Well, I know, but I've never been a mother - and you're the father.
We're already good parents, we just don't have a kid yet, and when we get one, we're going to be incredible, and you can't tell me otherwise.
So, it'll be a cinch for me.
All I know is, she's the one over there painting a nursery for our grandchild.
I'd have thought it was child's play for you.
A girl who didn't want his child.
Yeah, no... it's all good-- didn't really want kids anyway.
Why am I not supposed to have a baby this way?
Kid's mom thought it was a little odd because she wasn't there with a child of her own, so mom mentioned it to a patrolman.
I asked her where the baby was, and she said -- she said that she didn't want any baby of hers to ever have someone like me as a father because I was "unreliable".
You were the kind of kid that the best thing that I could do was just let go and watch you figure things out for yourself.
I never thought I wanted to be a mother. But things are different now.
Mine wants no more children, but I I should give him a boy.
I never thought I'd have a child until I met Ron, and then we just both thought, why not?
